text: Well, my colleague, Ted Cruz, said it looked just like Goodfellas. As a First Amendment guy, myself, I think he’s probably got it right. You don’t have to like what somebody says on TV to agree that the government shouldn’t be getting involved here.

Great to meet with @kentuckyguard leadership today in Washington and discuss defense priorities for our nation and the Commonwealth. I’m grateful to our brave soldiers and airmen who serve in the Kentucky National Guard—they make all of us proud. https://t.co/bNiTdD09cO

If passionate disagreement is a sign of a healthy democracy, political violence like yesterday’s sickening display is a sign of decay. My thoughts in the @CourierJournal today regarding political violence threatening the fabric of American society:
https://t.co/6xdOwVkCHI

Proud to see Chad Meredith voted favorably out of @SenJudiciaryGOP today. @POTUS made an excellent choice in nominating Chad to the US District Court for the Eastern District of KY. Chad is a brilliant attorney who will serve our country well & I look forward to his confirmation.

The perpetrators of 9/11 intended to deal our nation a fatal blow. But the sacrifice of first responders, valor of servicemembers, and strength of communities proved them wrong. Today, and every day, one nation under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all. https://t.co/m52TDfS9hQ
The news out of Utah is horrific. There is no place for political violence in our country. Please join me in praying for Charlie Kirk and his family.

If we call it the Dept. of War, we'd better equip the military to actually prevent and win wars. Can't preserve American primacy if we're unwilling to spend substantially more on our military than Carter or Biden. "Peace through strength" requires investment, not just rebranding.

This announcement is great news for Harrodsburg! It builds on their strong partnership and is a proud testament to the hardworking men and women at the facility. I enjoyed visiting the facility and its employees and I’m proud of the work they do there. https://t.co/hMzkR7gpC5

We all know children love candy. They can recognize well-known brands of candy before they can even read! The packaging on these snacks is nearly identical to a pack of Oreos, Doritos, or Skittles. Little do kids know, these products are all laced with intoxicating, synthetic chemicals. https://t.co/yIBMArXrOU

#FlashbackFriday 
Great to be at the White House with President Trump discussing strategy. https://t.co/YaLm9MrYBi

.@usedgov will release pending education funding to ensure Kentucky’s school districts are ready for the upcoming school year. I want to take this opportunity to thank @SenCapito for leading the effort. Local communities know best how to utilize these dollars, and Kentucky’s students and parents will benefit greatly from this decision.

This is great news for the Paducah community, and I want to thank President Trump for selecting the Paducah Site to host new AI infrastructure. The site at the Paducah Gaseous Diffusion Plant has long held a critical role in advancing U.S. national security, and is poised, yet again, to be a national leader in an emerging and important technology. I am proud of the Paducah community and its workforce and know they are prepared to continue working closely with the Department of Energy to further instill PGDP’s role in national security while helping facilitate greater U.S. leadership in AI.

President Trump announced today he has approved two disaster declarations for Kentucky. Thank you @POTUS, this is great news for those still recovering from the storms that impacted the Commonwealth in April and May of this year.

Conservatives across America are honoring the life of Ed Feulner, founder and longest-serving President of the Heritage Foundation. Ed was a great man, and I am glad to have called him a friend through the years. Under Ed’s leadership, the Heritage Foundation was a bastion of Reagan conservatism and a steadfast ally in the fight for freedom and a strong defense. His dedication to promoting peace through strength at the end of the Cold War offers a particularly enduring lesson. Elaine and I are deeply saddened to learn of Ed’s passing, and we are thinking of his family during this time.

Great news for students and parents across Kentucky. I am pleased @usedgov is releasing the funding for after-school and summer education programs. I want to thank @SenCapito for her leadership on the issue and I was glad to join her in calling for the release of these funds. https://t.co/G2VipmnDDQ
I enjoyed celebrating the passage of One Big Beautiful Bill with President Trump and Senate Republicans tonight at the White House dinner. https://t.co/2SKML5vwkp

Sad news out of central Kentucky. Please keep the families of the two Richmond Road Baptist Church members who were killed & those injured, including a Kentucky State Police Trooper, in your prayers. Elaine and I are grateful to our local law enforcement for their swift response.
https://t.co/kYc2q2SqNQ

The Protecting American Farmlands Act addresses the steady decline in available farmland by easing the tax burden on our hardworking producers. This is a huge win for Kentucky farmers and will help preserve our vital farmland for future generations.

The U.S Senate just passed President Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill. We’re bolstering border security, investing in programs that assist our farmers, raising take-home pay for working Kentuckians, and preventing the largest tax hike in American history. My full statement below: https://t.co/zM2qnJiXi2

.@SenThomTillis is one of the most effective and collegial members that I have ever served with in the United States Senate. His announcement is a big setback for the Senate and the Republican Conference. I want to thank him for his service in this institution representing the people of North Carolina and our nation.

Iran’s war on America and Israel spans decades. The history of the Islamic Republic is written in American, Israeli, and Arab blood, as well as that of the Iranian people. The regime’s survival has depended on repression at home and web of proxy terrorism and aggression abroad, underpinned by an obsessive pursuit of nuclear weapons.

Israel’s bold response to the war thrust upon it by Iran’s proxies has created a unique opportunity to cripple Iran’s nuclear ambitions and strike a lasting blow to its hegemonic aggression. Seizing this opportunity is not an escalation toward war — it is a prudent response to the warmongers in Tehran. Iran would be foolish to misunderstand American resolve.

I commend the President for authorizing decisive action and all U.S. servicemembers responsible for carrying it out. The United States’ interest in denying Iran a nuclear weapon, in standing with our ally, Israel, and in reestablishing credible deterrent power is undeniable and urgent.

President Trump made an outstanding choice for his nomination to the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Kentucky. Chad Meredith is a bright lawyer with a stellar resume and a distinguished record of public service, including previous service as Kentucky’s Solicitor General. His demonstrated devotion to the rule of law and the Constitution will serve the people of Kentucky well on the federal bench. I look forward to the Senate confirming his nomination.

The Ft. Campbell community suffered a second tragic loss in a week. The deaths of two soldiers – one on deployment in Europe and one at Ft. Campbell – remind us of the daily risks servicemembers face. I'm praying for these soldiers' families and the entire 101st Airborne Division as they grieve.

On this Memorial Day, we pause as one nation to remember the brave men and women in uniform who paid the ultimate price to defend our freedoms – and we also remember their loved ones in our prayers. https://t.co/J7Y0zuJcfI

After seeing the damage first hand yesterday, this federal assistance will help so many Kentuckians who are still picking up the pieces. Grateful to @POTUS for granting the Governor’s request for a major disaster declaration for Caldwell, Laurel, Pulaski, Russell, Trigg, and Union Counties.

Today, I was honored to meet with Benton Mayor Rita Dotson, President of the @KyLeagueCities, to accept the 2025 Key to Kentucky Cities award. We discussed pressing issues facing local governments and municipalities across the Commonwealth. https://t.co/KwhNKfdNIi

I joined my Senate Republican colleagues in voting to overturn California’s extreme electric vehicle rule. The Biden Administration wanted to use California as a model to slap a radical and unprecedented mandate on our country, cutting down the marketplace of affordable, reliable vehicles that everyday Americans choose to drive. Senate Republicans will not allow California to mandate the actions of consumers and businesses in the rest of the country.

Among the innocent victims of 10/7 were young peacemakers. Last night, terrorist murder on the streets of Washington claimed the lives of two more. Yaron and Sarah had attended a discussion on responding to humanitarian crises, incl. in Gaza. Their alleged killer, grotesquely invoking the will of the Palestinian people, thought better that these peacemakers should die. 
My deepest sympathies are with those who loved Yaron and Sarah, with their colleagues at the Israeli Embassy in Washington, and with all working to bring Hamas’ reign of terror to an end. America must continue to stand with our ally, Israel, and with the Israeli people who continue to face existential threats from Iran and its proxies. I pray that no American will mistake last night’s anti-Semitic terrorism for advancing the cause of peace.

Met with @DKambUSA Sørensen and Acting @GreenlandRepDC Lynge. America has been fortunate to have capable Danish allies in our corner when we’ve needed them most. The future of the US-Denmark relationship must be rooted in that same trust, mutual respect, and shared interests. https://t.co/NkmmPAfQzh

President Biden and his family are no strangers to the fight against cancer. But as an advocate and a father, our former Senate colleague has met its bitter cruelties with the utmost grace. Elaine and I are keeping him and the entire Biden family in our prayers.

Last nights storms in Kentucky were devastating. I am praying for the lives lost and communities impacted. Thank you to our first responders for their brave efforts amid this tragedy. I will work with federal, state and local officials to aid our communities with the resources they need to recover.

Today, the Senate Judiciary Committee passed the Chief Herbert D. Proffitt Act. This bill fills a major void, allowing the families of our law enforcement officers to receive the support they deserve. I was proud to lead on this legislation honoring the late Chief Proffitt of Tompkinsville, KY. https://t.co/kP1JpjS5PH

I am honored to welcome the Kentuckians who have traveled to the Nation's Capital for Police Week. The brave men and women who protect and serve my home state of Kentucky put themselves in harm’s way to defend our communities every day, and we owe them a tremendous debt of gratitude.

It was an honor to proudly cosponsor the resolution designating this week as ‘National Police Week.’ We are all safer because of their efforts, and this week is an important reminder of their continuing service and sacrifice — each and every day.

This week, we remember law enforcement officers who have fallen this year in the line of duty and honor those across the country who courageously serve our communities. On behalf of all Kentuckians, I’m grateful for our police officers and their steadfast dedication to keeping us safe.

I joined @ChuckGrassley & @SenatorShaheen in introducing a resolution designating April 20, 2025, as “National Fentanyl Awareness Day." Fentanyl and fentanyl-like substances kill more Kentuckians than any other illegal drug. Read the resolution here: https://t.co/7wpkR71yKW

Elaine and I join people of faith around the world in mourning the passing of his holiness, Pope Francis. From the beginning of his papacy, the Holy Father invited Christians from every walk of life to more fully embrace the call to care for the vulnerable, including the unborn and the poorest among us. He reminded us by word and deed that we are all called to lives of faithful service. Now, as the shepherd of more than a billion Roman Catholics reaps his eternal reward, we give thanks for a life of witness to the truth: Our hearts are restless until they rest in God.

Today, I received a briefing from @LouisvilleMayor and his team on the impact of recent storms across Jefferson County. I’m thankful for all the volunteers helping our community recover. I also want to recognize the hard work of 911 operators at the Louisville Metro Call Center. https://t.co/1kUL7vaAlD

Today’s executive order supporting coal-fired power plants will begin to roll back years of Obama-Biden regulatory overreach that targeted those who generate affordable and reliable American energy. For years, the Biden EPA’s war on fossil fuels forced more miners into early retirement, hurt rural communities, raised energy prices, and weakened our national security while China, our top strategic competitor made massive investments in expanding coal production. The Trump Administration is taking the necessary steps to preserve an industry that is vital to the livelihoods of Kentucky families, and I’ll continue to stand firmly behind the Kentuckians and workers across coal country who keep the lights on.

Please keep Kentucky in your prayers. Just this morning, there are terrible reports of a child being swept away by floodwaters on his way to school. The Commonwealth continues to endure flash flood and tornado warnings. I appreciate the Trump Administration’s quick approval of an Emergency Declaration for Kentucky and the efforts of emergency responders who are working overtime.

Tariffs make it more expensive to do business in America, driving up costs for producers and consumers across the board. In Kentucky, broad-based tariffs could even have long-term consequences right in our backyard. Consider our state’s 69,000 family farms that sell their crops around the globe, or the hardworking Kentuckians who craft 95% of the world’s bourbon, or our automotive and manufacturing industries that rely on global supply chains. Make no mistake: goods made in America will be more expensive to manufacture and, ultimately, for consumers to purchase, with higher broad-based tariffs.  At a time when Americans are tightening their belts, we would do well to avoid policies that heap on the pain. We ought to strengthen our friendships abroad, and reinforce our allies as pillars of American prosperity and security.

As I have always warned, tariffs are bad policy, and trade wars with our partners hurt working people most. Tariffs drive up the cost of goods and services. They are a tax on everyday working Americans. Preserving the long-term prosperity of American industry and workers requires working with our allies, not against them. With so much at stake globally, the last thing we need is to pick fights with the very friends with whom we should be working with to protect against China’s predatory and unfair trade practices. That includes what we do on trade.

Glad to meet with Kim Aris to discuss the cause of democracy in Burma and the unjust detention of his mother, and my friend, Aung San Suu Kyi. I share Mr. Aris' concern about the brutality of the junta, and I call again on its leaders to release Daw Suu and other political prisoners, and to end its war against the people of Burma.

Voted today to confirm Dr. Jay Bhattacharya to lead the National Institutes of Health. With an extensive background in medical research, I expect @DrJBhattacharya to provide sound leadership at the @NIH. https://t.co/R9E2NSBPj1

Glad to meet today with America's Baltic allies. Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania take collective defense seriously. They are clear-eyed about the threats we face together, and they allocate resources accordingly to maintain readiness. @NATO's front line remains vigilant. @MFAestonia @Latvian_MFA @LithuaniaMFA

Voted today to confirm the next @SECNAV. There’s urgent work ahead: countering our adversaries growing alignment and alarming capabilities/capacity with serious and sustained investments in American hard power.

Fentanyl and fentanyl-like substances kill more Kentuckians than any other illegal drug. The HALT Fentanyl Act gives law enforcement another tool in their belt to stem the flow of illegal drugs into our communities. While there is much more work ahead in the fight to end the opioid epidemic, this legislation is a step in the right direction.

Proud to welcome @SecGenNATO Rutte to the Senate. The most successful military alliance in world history didn't happen by accident. @NATO’s power to deter conflict requires capability and credibility. As allies invest more in collective defense, the U.S. must lead by example. https://t.co/ac32SIIDXq

Glad to meet with John Phelan, the next Secretary of the Navy. We talked about growing threats and urgent priorities like re-building industrial capacity and deepening cooperation with allies from the Atlantic to the Indo-Pacific. I have no doubt Mr. Phelan will hit the ground running as Secretary.

Elaine and I were saddened to hear about the passing of our friend, Junior Bridgeman. Not only was he a proud Louisville Cardinal, he was a successful businessman and philanthropist who loved the University and the City he called home. Elaine and I send our condolences to his wife, Doris, his three children and all those who knew and loved him. He will be missed.

Glad to meet today with the next Deputy Secretary of Defense, Steve Feinberg. We discussed in detail the growing threats to American interests world-wide and the urgent requirements of our defense and intelligence enterprise.  I look forward to confirming Steve and working closely with him on these priorities.

Severe weather is impacting communities all across Kentucky. First responders are moving quickly to rescue and evacuate people, and I’m thankful for their heroic work to keep Kentuckians safe. My team is in touch with federal, state and local officials to help however we can. I want to thank @POTUS for his quick approval of @GovAndyBeshear’s request for an Emergency Disaster Declaration for the Commonwealth.

Today, tens of thousands of proud, pro-life Americans will descend on our nation’s capital for the annual March for Life. For over half a century, this movement has united people across all ages, faiths, and backgrounds. I’m committed to supporting this fundamental issue in the Senate, and I’m proud of my 100% rating from the National Right to Life Committee. This week, I voted once again in support of legislation that would protect babies who survive abortions. Kentuckians agree that defending a child’s life – as the law states – shouldn’t be a partisan issue. Unfortunately, Democrats once again blocked passage of this commonsense legislation. So I welcome this year’s March for Life advocates, especially the many Kentuckians, gathered today to send a clear message that our country respects and values life. Washington needs your example of advocacy more than ever as we work to protect this most basic human right.

After 894 harrowing days of wrongful detention by the Taliban, Ryan Corbett is finally coming home to his family. I commend all those involved in securing Ryan’s release, especially Ryan’s wife Anna, who tirelessly fought for her husband’s freedom up until this long-awaited moment... we must continue to stand for the release of all Americans unjustly imprisoned in Afghanistan. Without restoring deterrence and raising the stakes of hostage-taking, innocent Americans will continue to be used as bargaining chips by adversary nations around the world.

The President is fortunate to have Marco Rubio on the job as Secretary of State. Our longtime Senate colleague has built deep foreign policy expertise and demonstrated determination to meet threats around the world with strength. He will bring to the State Department a sorely needed moral clarity and a renewed recognition of hard power and deterrence as foundations of effective diplomacy.

My take in @WSJOpinion on @POTUS blocking investment in American industry and workers:
https://t.co/jwZumOEDEQ

In the wake of terrorist savagery, our obligation is to deliver justice. However long it takes, those responsible for September 11th deserve nothing more, and the families of their victims deserve nothing less. Proud to reintroduce the Justice For 9/11 Act with @SenTomCotton.
In print today. My assessment of the urgent work ahead:

Tonight, Jews around the world will celebrate the first night of Hanukkah. Let us join in celebrating the strength of the Jewish people and reaffirm our commitment to make sure they live free from fear.
Today, I want to wish a Merry Christmas to my fellow Kentuckians and everyone across our nation. I am especially grateful to our men and women in uniform who are away from home keeping us safe.
The United States urgently needs to reach a bipartisan consensus on the centrality of hard power to U.S. foreign policy. Read my full essay in @ForeignAffairs: https://t.co/Z463yFxxPk

It’s not every day that a judge has a retirement party and then tells the President he’s going to keep his job. I expect that Judge Wynn will face significant ethics complaints based on Canons 2 and 5 of the Code of Conduct for U.S. Judges, followed by serial recusal demands from the Department of Justice. He’s earned it.

After the American people fired Democrats last month, an unprecedented two federal judges who had announced their retirement reversed course. Judges are supposed to wear black robes, not Democratic blue. The judiciary ought to leave politics to the proper branches.

Today, I want to wish a Happy Thanksgiving to families across Kentucky and our country. I’m especially grateful to the men and women in uniform who are serving away from home to protect the blessings we celebrate today.
This is damning...Not for Israel, but for the impotent sham court flaunting its lack of moral clarity as a badge of honor.

Those who mourn senseless human suffering in Israel and Gaza should assign blame to the terrorists responsible. And those who seek peace should know better than to pretend we can achieve it while such savages hold power. The Senate must reject @SenSanders’ anti-Israel resolutions.

My full remarks: https://t.co/jjwZBkdaaj

Today: 45 Hong Kong democracy activists sentenced under "national security" law. Tomorrow: Jimmy Lai's sham trial resumes. “One country, two systems” is wishful thinking. Glad @marcorubio, a strong leader on Hong Kong, will stand up to PRC authoritarian designs from @StateDept.

.@SenJohnThune's election is a clear endorsement of a consummate leader. Senate Republicans stand behind him, ready to get to work.

My full statement: https://t.co/o0YW5w1Q65

I was proud to help return a Republican majority to the Senate, and thrilled to welcome some of the newest GOP senators to the Capitol this afternoon. I look forward to working with them for the American people. https://t.co/zaMPmJmnzP

Today, U.S. servicemembers are deployed around the globe, following the footsteps of generations whose service and sacrifice preserved the American experiment. Veterans Day is a reminder of the great debt we owe them. To veterans, servicemembers, and military families: thank you.

Iran sent hundreds of missiles at Israeli civilians. Israel's response targeted the engine of terror that equips Houthi attacks on U.S. vessels and Russian attacks on Ukraine. We must recognize what Israel already does: the objective is deterrence, not diplomacy for its own sake.

Yahya Sinwar was the mastermind of the largest slaughter of Jews since the Holocaust, and today, families shattered on October 7th have a small measure of justice. Israel has yet again demonstrated what it means to impose costs on adversaries, and America ought to take notes.

The federal judicial bureaucracy is on a crusade against so-called single-judge divisions – the sort of courts that rural litigants rely on, including in parts of Kentucky. It’s time for this interference to end.

Read my op-ed in @NRO: https://t.co/wUn1oGkQYa

Today, as Americans and free people around the world remember the victims of October 7th and pray for peace, let us recommit to stand with Israel in its righteous fight.
 
My full statement: https://t.co/5YwPfn379z

It is not enough to intercept missiles and drones moments before they reach civilians in Israel or U.S. personnel in the Red Sea. It is time for America to act like the friend of Israel we claim to be, and for Iran and its proxies to face severe consequences.
 
Full statement: https://t.co/9lj8nchJL9
For the attention of any of my colleagues who still want to send American tax dollars to UNRWA: https://t.co/DBsFuKI9tW

Like Mugniyah and Soleimani before him, Hassan Nasrallah authored decades of terror and suffering across the Middle East. Israelis, Americans, Lebanese, and Syrians are safer without him on the battlefield. America should heed this reminder of what it means to impose costs and justice on those who wish us harm.
